questions.question: What is the main purpose of Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)?

answers.a: To assign permissions directly to each user
answers.b: To group permissions into roles and assign those roles to users
answers.c: To allow unrestricted access to all users

explanations.a: Incorrect. RBAC avoids direct permission assignment to simplify access management.
explanations.b: Correct. RBAC groups permissions into roles and assigns the roles to users.
explanations.c: Incorrect. RBAC is designed to restrict access based on roles.
explanations.d: Incorrect. RBAC manages permissions, not account status.

questions.question: Which statement best describes Discretionary Access Control (DAC)?

answers.a: Access is controlled strictly by security labels and clearance levels
answers.b: Users receive permissions only through predefined roles
answers.c: The owner of an object can grant and revoke access to others
answers.d: Permissions are assigned automatically by the system

explanations.a: Incorrect. This describes Mandatory Access Control (MAC).
explanations.b: Incorrect. This describes RBAC, not DAC.
explanations.c: Correct. In DAC, the owner decides who gets access using GRANT/REVOKE.
explanations.d: Incorrect. DAC requires explicit permission decisions by the data owner.

questions.question: What is the core principle of Mandatory Access Control (MAC)?

answers.a: Permissions are decided by the data owner
answers.b: Access decisions are based on roles defined by administrators
answers.c: Access is granted according to security labels and clearance levels
answers.d: All users are given the same permissions

explanations.c: Correct. MAC enforces access based on classification and user clearance.
explanations.d: Incorrect. MAC enforces strict differentiated access rules.

questions.question: In DAC, what does the WITH GRANT OPTION allow a user to do?

answers.b: Grant the same permissions to another user

explanations.a: Incorrect. WITH GRANT OPTION does not allow table deletion.
explanations.b: Correct. WITH GRANT OPTION allows users to pass granted privileges to others.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Clearance levels belong to MAC.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It does not relate to account modification.

questions.question: Which rule is commonly enforced in MAC systems?

answers.a: No Read Up and No Write Down
answers.c: Permissions depend only on job titles

explanations.a: Correct. MAC enforces strict rules like 'No Read Up' and 'No Write Down'.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Job-title-based access belongs to RBAC.

questions.question: How does RBAC simplify privilege management in large systems?

answers.a: By allowing users to change their own permissions
answers.b: By assigning permissions directly to users individually
answers.c: By grouping permissions into roles and reassigning users as needed
answers.d: By removing the need for administrators

explanations.a: Incorrect. Users cannot change their own permissions.
explanations.b: Incorrect. RBAC avoids direct assignment to users.
explanations.c: Correct. RBAC simplifies management by assigning users to roles instead of handling individual privileges.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Administrators are still needed to define roles.
